title.narrative: Fostering Self-Reliance for Displaced Syrians in South Lebanon (FORDS)

description.narrative:
Overall objective: To help the displaced Syrians in South Lebanon cope with the effects of the crisis.
Specific objective: To enhance the livelihoods of displaced Syrians in South Lebanon through increased income generation.
Result 1: 160 displaced Syrians and up to 40 local community members have acquired skills relevant to the job market.
Result 2: Tailored support provided to Syrian refugees and local community members to launch income-generation activities.
Result 3: 7 new businesses and 3 cooperatives employ Syrian workers.

The project is designed in line with the global objective of the Call: it will help the Syrian population cope with the effects of the crisis by focusing on the displaced Syrians in Lebanon. Furthermore, the action will contribute to achieving the first specific objective of the Call: addressing medium-term non-humanitarian needs of the Syrian population.
Activities foreseen in the proposed action will span across activity areas. Using a multisectoral approach the action will support livelihoods and provide vocational training to Syrian refugees and a number of local community members. Education and vocational training activities will be closely interlinked with livelihood support activities, which will include support to vocational start-ups, and work with small businesses and cooperatives to promote temporary employment of refugees. The action will support Syrian refugees to become more resilient, and able to provide for their families’ basic needs without humanitarian assistance. In a longer term, the action will provide Syrian refugees with skills they can use for income generation and business development upon their return to Syria.
